abstract: Nomura, the Japanese investment bank, has won a court ruling in London against WestLB, the German regional lender, over a structured note deal that caused losses during the financial crisis.
snippet: Nomura, the Japanese investment bank, has won a court ruling in London against WestLB, the German regional lender, over a structured note deal that caused losses during the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: 2:13 p.m. | Updated Nomura, the Japanese investment bank that bought Lehman Brothers’ international operations in 2008, has won a High Court ruling in London against WestLB, the German regional lender, over a structured note deal that caused losses during the financial crisis.
